review.title: Tweets Miner for Stock Market Analysis
review.abstract: In this paper, we present a software package for the data mining of Twitter microblogs for the purpose of using them for the stock market analysis. The package is written in R langauge using apropriate R packages. The model of tweets has been considered. We have also compared stock market charts with frequent sets of keywords in Twitter microblogs messages.

metadata.title: Tweets Miner for Stock Market Analysis

sections.text: Tweets Miner for Stock Market Analysis Bohdan PavlyshenkoElectronics Department, Ivan Franko Lviv National University, Ukraine, Drahomanov Str. 50, Lviv, 79005, Ukraine, e-mail: b.pavlyshenko @ gmail.com In this post we present a software package for data mining of Twitter microblogs for use in stock market analysis. The package is written in R-Long Eye and uses matching R-Packages. The model of tweets has been considered. We have also compared stock exchange charts with frequent keywords in Twitter microblogs. Keywords: Twitter, tweets, data mining, frequency sets, stock exchange.

sections.heading: Introduction
sections.text: "The Twitter microblogging system is one of the most popular means of user-to-user interaction via short messages (up to 140 characters)." Twitter messages are characterized by a high density of contextually significant keywords. (This characteristic determines the availability of the study of microblogs through the use of data mining to identify semantic relationships between the main concepts and topics of discussion in microblogs.) Very promising is the analysis of the predictive ability of time dependencies of the main quantitative characteristics of thematic concepts in Twitter microblogs "messages. The peculiarities of social networks and user behavior are explored in many studies. (1) Microblogging phenomena have been investigated. The influence of users on Twitter has been analyzed in social networks. (3) In [4] the methods of opinion formation of Twitter corpus have been analyzed. Several papers are devoted to the analysis of possible predictions of events in microblogs.

referenceMentions.context: In [1] the microblogging phenomena were investigated.
Users' influence in Twitter was studied in [2].
Users' behavior in social networks is analyzed in [3].
In [4] the methods of opinion mining of Twitter corpus were analyzed.
In [5] it was studied whether public mood, as measured from large-scale collection of tweets, posted on twitter.
